Eligibility: The Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) achieved a yield of 0 to 2
A measurable disease as defined by the criteria for assessing response in solid tumours (RECIST)
Prior treatment with anthracyclines with a cumulative dose of doxorubicin or equivalent of more than 300 mg/m^2
Patients with significant cardiac risk factors
Metastasis of the active central nervous system
Results: The DLT is defined as any Grade 3 neratinib-related adverse reaction or Grade 4 adverse reaction (AR) in accordance with the National Cancer Institute (NCI) Common Terminology Criteria (CTC) for Version 3.0 AEs.
Time: from first dose to day 14
Title of the arm/group: Neratinib 40 mg
Description of the arm/group: Neratinb 40 mg qd
Type of measure: Number of participants
Title of the arm/group: Neratinib 80 mg
Description of the arm/group: Neratinib 80 mg qd
Type of measure: Number of participants
